alert.note: Alert for Quay County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 3:28AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL QUAY COUNTY THROUGH 400 AM MDT... At 328 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles south of Nara Visa, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Glenrio and Bard. This includes Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 363 and 373. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.
